ch.uzh.agglorecommender.client

Interface IDataset

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    InputParser.Dataset, RandomDataset, TestDataset

    public interface IDataset
extends java.io.Serializable
    An abstraction of a data set. Provides means to fetch the input data from a data set as data items.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double denormalize(double value, java.lang.String attributeTag)
      Scales the passed value to the range defined in the data set property files.
      com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> getAttributeClusteringConfig()
      Gets a immutable map that indicates for each attribute (-tag) if it should be used for clustering.
      INormalizer getNormalizer()
      Gets a normalizer for the data set.
      java.util.Iterator<IDatasetItem> iterateOverDatasetItems()
      Retrieve the data of the data set.

    • Method Detail

      • iterateOverDatasetItems

        java.util.Iterator<IDatasetItem> iterateOverDatasetItems()
        Retrieve the data of the data set.
        Returns:
        an iterator over all data set items in the data set.

      • getNormalizer

        INormalizer getNormalizer()
        Gets a normalizer for the data set.
        Returns:
        the corresponding normalizer.

      • getAttributeClusteringConfig

        com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> getAttributeClusteringConfig()
        Gets a immutable map that indicates for each attribute (-tag) if it should be used for clustering.
        Returns:
        map of attribute-tags to boolean values

      • denormalize

        double denormalize(double value,
                 java.lang.String attributeTag)
        Scales the passed value to the range defined in the data set property files.
        Parameters:
        value - a normalized value
        attributeTag - the identifier of the attribute
        Returns:
        the attribute value in the original scale
